name: Wood Ear
description: The Wood Ear (Auricularia auricula-judae), also called Jelly Ear or Mu-Err, is a gelatinous edible and medicinal mushroom with an ear-shaped appearance. Widely used in Asian cuisine, it is known for its blood-thinning properties (Szechwan syndrome). The fungus grows year-round on hardwood, especially on elder, and is frost-resistant. Its medicinal applications include arteriosclerosis, hypertension and inflammation.
